alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 18 at 3:58AM MDT until May 18 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including recent burn scars in the following areas, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...From Noon MDT today through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations, especially 2021 and newer burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A backdoor cold front penetrating an unseasonably moist atmosphere will produce numerous showers and thunderstorms this afternoon. Some thunderstorms will be capable of locally heavy rain at rates approaching 1 inch per hour. In addition, moderate to heavy rainfall may cause snowpack on higher peaks to melt rapidly, adding to the runoff from showers and thunderstorms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
